p: Over an eight year period, C. odorata can store 4.45 tons of C ha -1 [ 51]. Thus, we estimate that in the 35,377 km 2 where we found have optimum conditions for its establishment, it could store approximately 15,743,094 tons of carbon over the same time span. Regarding mitigation activities, Xu and colleagues [ 11] found that the activity with the least investment required per ton of C is forest regeneration, followed by a long-rotation plantation cycle and forest protection. Given this, we suggest that C. odorata plantations would increase carbon capture with a potentially competitive investment cost per ton of carbon captured.
